intro: Linum repens, commonly known as匍匐亚麻 (prostrate flax), is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features slender, creeping stems that often lie close to the ground, forming a dense mat. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically pale blue or white, with five petals. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Linum repens is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
